title: Man who took in homeless family kicked out of home after they begin 'squatting'
text:

A man who took in a homeless family out of pity claims his "friends" have locked him out of his own home and begun squatting in the property.

Delton Anderson, 60, says he almost became 'homeless' himself after he found himself kicked out of his own home in Laindon, Basildon.

He told a local newspaper he had returned home in February to find his locks changed.

Mr Anderson told the Basildon Canvey Southend Echo News he had known the family for five or six years and had just been trying to help them out.

(Image: Getty Images/iStockphoto)

He reportedly owns the home in Laindon and had allowed a couple with three children who he had known for five to six years to stay at the property.

He said he was giving them time to save money for their own home after they were evicted from their old home.

But Mr Anderson said things took an unexpected turn in February.

“After a couple of months I started to ask them if they’d built up enough money. They kept saying soon. They then just locked me out. They’re literally squatting in my house."

He has since been able to live with his daughters in Basildon and Barking.

(Image: Getty Images/iStockphoto)

He claims to have asked his local council and police for help, and says officers told him to change the locks.

He said he doesn't think that will get rid of them, adding: "I'm so stressed. It's getting ridiculous."

A Basildon Council spokesperson said: “Since this is a civil matter, the council does not have the power to take any action.

"However, as a gesture of goodwill we have put the owner of the property in contact with the Citizen’s Advice Bureau to begin the legal process, which we understand is ongoing.

"The police have also been to the property several times to assist.”

Essex Police said the force was unable to comment as it is believed to be a civil matter.
description: The 60-year-old Good Samaritan claims a couple with three kids he took in turned on him and locked him out of his own home in Basildon
